questions.title: Two Numbers That Add Up (Explain Only)
questions.prompt: You are given a small list of numbers and a target. Explain how you would find two numbers that add up to the target, without writing code.
followups: Would you check every pair or keep track of numbers you have seen?
Why does your approach work?
How would you explain this to a beginner?

questions.title: Reverse a String (Thinking Process)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would reverse a string like "hello" step by step.
followups: Where would you start?
How do you know when to stop?
How would you check your result?

questions.title: Palindrome Check (Simple Reasoning)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if a word reads the same forward and backward.
followups: Would capitalization or spaces matter?
Why is checking from both ends useful?
How could you simplify the input first?

questions.title: Find the Largest Number
questions.prompt: You have a list of numbers. Explain how you would find the largest one.
followups: Would you compare numbers one by one?
How do you keep track of the current largest?
Why is this simple approach effective?

questions.title: Counting Items Using a Map
questions.prompt: You have a list of items like names or fruits. Explain how you would count how many times each item appears.
followups: Why is this better than counting manually?
What would the key and value represent?
Where is this useful in real applications?

questions.title: Remove Duplicate Items
questions.prompt: You have a list with repeated items. Explain how you would keep only one of each item.
followups: How do you know when something repeats?
Does order matter?
What would change if the list was very large?

questions.title: Binary Search (Conceptual)
questions.prompt: You have a sorted list of numbers. Explain how you could find a number faster than checking every element.
followups: Why does sorting help?
Why wouldn’t this work on an unsorted list?
What real-life example is similar?

questions.title: Merge Two Sorted Lists (High Level)
questions.prompt: You have two sorted lists of numbers. Explain how you would merge them into one sorted list.
followups: Which elements would you compare first?
What happens when one list ends?
How would you explain this visually?

questions.title: Valid Parentheses (Idea Level)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if brackets in a string are correctly matched.
followups: Why does order matter?
What would make the string invalid?
What real-life situation is similar?

questions.title: Loops (Practical Use)
questions.prompt: Explain when and why you would use a loop in a program.
followups: What happens if you don’t use loops?
What is a common mistake with loops?
How do you make sure a loop stops?

questions.title: If Statements (Decision Making)
questions.prompt: Explain how an if statement helps a program make decisions.
followups: What happens when the condition is false?
Can you give a real-life example?
Why are conditions important?

questions.title: Functions (Why They Matter)
questions.prompt: Explain why breaking code into functions is helpful.
followups: How do functions help with reuse?
How do they make debugging easier?
What happens if everything is in one function?

questions.title: Arrays vs Linked Lists (Practical Difference)
questions.prompt: Explain one practical difference between arrays and linked lists.
followups: Which one is easier to use?
Which one is more flexible?
Why might a company choose one over the other?

questions.title: Big-O (Intuition Only)
questions.prompt: Without using formulas, explain what Big-O helps developers think about.
followups: Why does performance matter?
Is the fastest solution always necessary?
When is a simple solution good enough?

questions.title: Debugging Basics
questions.prompt: Your program doesn’t work as expected. Explain the first steps you would take to debug it.
followups: Why start with small checks?
What tools would you use first?
When would you ask for help?

questions.title: Testing a Simple Function
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check that a small function works correctly.
followups: Why test more than one input?
What happens if you skip testing?
How do tests help later?

questions.title: Why Apple? (Easy Technical Angle)
questions.prompt: Why do you want to intern at Apple, and how does software contribute to Apple’s products?
followups: What Apple product do you like?
How does software improve user experience?
What do you hope to learn at Apple?
